title: Anti-Party Hopping Act needs to be tightened, says Mohamad Hasan
summary: The Anti-Party Hopping Act should be reviewed to overcome the existing loopholes, thus preventing Members of Parliament or Members of the State Assembly (Adun) from jumping to the opposing party.
content:
KOTA TINGGI (July 13): The Anti-Party Hopping Act should be reviewed to overcome the existing loopholes, thus preventing Members of Parliament or Members of the State Assembly (Adun) from jumping to the opposing party.

Umno deputy president Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan said the matter should be done to ensure that the country is not thrown into disarray by the actions of politicians who prioritise personal interests rather than empowering the government after being elected by the people.

title: Cutting red tape drives growth of EV charging stations — Zafrul
summary: The number of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations nationwide increased by 12.5% as of June 25, compared to the first quarter of this year, driven by the government's efforts to reduce bureaucratic hurdles in the installation process.
content:
IPOH (July 13): The number of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations nationwide increased by 12.5% as of June 25, compared to the first quarter of this year, driven by the government's efforts to reduce bureaucratic hurdles in the installation process.

Investment, Trade, and Industry Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz said that previously, approvals involved numerous agencies and ministries, including the Energy Commission, local authorities, and the Fire and Rescue Department.

title: Upcoming Public Service Remuneration System among the best ever, says Anwar
summary: The Public Service Remuneration System (SSPA) that will be announced soon is among the best ever implemented by the government, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
BANGI (July 13): The Public Service Remuneration System (SSPA) that will be announced soon is among the best ever implemented by the government, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

He said the SSPA would be announced soon and finalised during Budget 2025.

"I want to ensure that when I announce it (SSPA), all gaps are filled," he said at the Golden Jubilee celebration of the National Union of Teaching Profession (NUTP) here on Saturday.

title: AG's Report: LCS procurement process refers to earlier construction, says Mohamed Khaled
summary: The Auditor General's Report (LKAN) on the process of procurement of littoral combat ships (LCS) which is said to be at a low level refers to the previous construction status and not the latest.
content:
MACHANG (July 13): The Auditor General's Report (LKAN) on the process of procurement of littoral combat ships (LCS) which is said to be at a low level refers to the previous construction status and not the latest.

Defence Minister Datuk Seri Mohamed Khaled Nordin said construction of the LCS resumed as soon as the unity government took over the reins of government, even launching the first LCS ship into the water for testing on May 23.

title: Rules on prohibition of e-cigarette sales expected to be implemented soon, says health minister
summary: Specific regulations and orders related to the prohibition on the sale of electronic cigarettes (e-cigarettes) or vape products including the sale of e-cigarettes through vending machines are expected to be implemented soon.
content:
KANGAR (July 13): Specific regulations and orders related to the prohibition on the sale of electronic cigarettes (e-cigarettes) or vape products including the sale of e-cigarettes through vending machines are expected to be implemented soon.

Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr Dzulkefly Ahmad said the Attorney General's Chambers is now in the final stages of researching the regulations regarding the ban before they are approved.

“We will monitor nationwide on this ma

title: Water cut notice tag issued to customers with overdue bills — Air Selangor
summary: Pengurusan Air Selangor Sdn Bhd (Air Selangor) has confirmed that the water supply disconnection notice label circulating on social media is legitimate.
content:
SHAH ALAM (July 13): Pengurusan Air Selangor Sdn Bhd (Air Selangor) has confirmed that the water supply disconnection notice label circulating on social media is legitimate.

In a post on its Facebook page, the company said that the notice label is used for customers with outstanding bills.

“Customers who receive the notice label but do not have any overdue bills should contact us at 15300 or submit an enquiry at the Help Centre available on

title: Unconventional Economic Wisdom: There is no debating who would be better for the US economy
summary: Something has been missing from the flood of commentary following the debate between US President Joe Biden and Donald Trump. While voters’ judgements about a candidate’s personality and personal strengths are important, everyone should remember the famous dictum: “It’s the economy, stupid.” In t...
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on July 8, 2024 - July 14, 2024

Something has been missing from the flood of commentary following the debate between US President Joe Biden and Donald Trump. While voters’ judgements about a candidate’s personality and personal strengths are important, everyone should remember the famous dictum: “It’s the economy, stupid.” In the firehose of outright lies that Trump spewed throughout the debate, the most danger

title: MCMC to enhance cooperation with PDRM to overcome cyberbullying
summary: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) welcomes the government's announcement to look into amending existing laws, including the Penal Code and the Communications and Multimedia Act 1998, and to consider the need to draft or create new acts to deal with the issue of cyberbullying.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 13): The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) welcomes the government's announcement to look into amending existing laws, including the Penal Code and the Communications and Multimedia Act 1998, and to consider the need to draft or create new acts to deal with the issue of cyberbullying.

MCMC in a statement on Saturday said the announcement sends an important signal that the government is committed and serious in dealing with the problem of cyberbullying that has resulte

title: Business Of Sports: Football’s Next Gen claim torch from Messi and Ronaldo
summary: As Gen Z footballers shine at both the European Championships and Copa America, there is an undeniable sense that the torch is being passed. Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo have lit the millennium like a pair of supernovas, but it is hard not to conclude that both are now raging against the dy...
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on July 8, 2024 - July 14, 2024

As Gen Z footballers shine at both the European Championships and Copa America, there is an undeniable sense that the torch is being passed. Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo have lit the millennium like a pair of supernovas, but it is hard not to conclude that both are now raging against the dying of the light.

title: The Week Ahead: Eyes on the King’s coronation, 2Q GDP estimate and China’s Third Plenum
summary: The coronation of Sultan Ibrahim as the 17th King of Malaysia at Istana Negara in Kuala Lumpur on Saturday (July 20) marks a historic moment for the country’s Constitutional Monarchy.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on July 15, 2024 - July 21, 2024

The coronation of Sultan Ibrahim as the 17th King of Malaysia at Istana Negara in Kuala Lumpur on Saturday (July 20) marks a historic moment for the country’s Constitutional Monarchy.

title: Charting IJM Corp’s next growth phase
summary: Construction giant IJM Corp Bhd (KL:IJM) is boldly stepping into a new era under the tutelage of group chief executive officer and managing director Lee Chun Fai, who took over the helm from construction marvel Tan Sri Krishnan Tan Boon Seng over 15 months ago.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 13): Construction giant IJM Corp Bhd (KL:IJM) is boldly stepping into a new era under the tutelage of group chief executive officer and managing director Lee Chun Fai, who took over the helm from construction marvel Tan Sri Krishnan Tan Boon Seng over 15 months ago.

And the changes being made on top of the strong foundation laid by Tan have not gone unnoticed. IJM’s share price reached an all-time high of RM3.47 on July 3. The counter was still up more than 80% year to date when it closed at

title: Japan households' inflation expectations heighten, quarterly survey shows
summary: TOKYO: Nearly 90 per cent of Japanese households expect prices to rise a year from now, a quarterly central bank survey showed on Friday, a sign of heightening inflation expectations that could help make the case for a near-term interest rate ...
content:
TOKYO: Nearly 90 per cent of Japanese households expect prices to rise a year from now, a quarterly central bank survey showed on Friday, a sign of heightening inflation expectations that could help make the case for a near-term interest rate hike.

But households were more pessimistic about current economic conditions compared with three months before, boding ill for the outlook on consumption.

Of the total households surveyed by the Bank of Japan (BOJ), 87.5 per cent said they expect prices to rise a year from now, up fr

title: China's exports top forecasts, but falling imports point to more stimulus
summary: BEIJING: China's exports grew at their fastest in fifteen months in June, suggesting manufacturers are front-loading orders ahead of tariffs expected from a growing number of trade partners, while imports unexpectedly shrank amid weak domestic demand.The mixed trade ...
content:
BEIJING: China's exports grew at their fastest in fifteen months in June, suggesting manufacturers are front-loading orders ahead of tariffs expected from a growing number of trade partners, while imports unexpectedly shrank amid weak domestic demand.

The mixed trade data keeps alive calls for further government stimulus as the $18.6 trillion economy struggles to get back on its feet. Analysts warn that the jury is still out on whether strong export sales in recent months can be sustained given major trade partners are bec

title: IRB's RM735mil extra tax bill to sharply hurt Astro?
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The additional RM735 million tax bill on Astro Malaysia Holdings Bhd will erode its shareholder fund and push its net tangible asset deeper into the negative territory, analysts said.News of the extra tax liability also sent Astro ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The additional RM735 million tax bill on Astro Malaysia Holdings Bhd will erode its shareholder fund and push its net tangible asset deeper into the negative territory, analysts said.

News of the extra tax liability also sent Astro shares down to a 52-week low, or by as much as 10 per cent, on Friday.

The Inland Revenue Board (IRB) served the company with notices of additional tax for assessment years 2019 to 2023 totalling RM734.88 million including penalties.

In a filing to Bursa Malaysia on Thursday

title: Aeon Credit's Q1 results within consensus' expectations?
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Aeon Credit Service (M) Bhd 's results for the first quarter ended May 31, 2024 (Q1 FY25) came in within RHB Research and consensus' expectations following their strong growth momentum. RHB Research noted the company's financing receivables maintained its ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Aeon Credit Service (M) Bhd 's results for the first quarter ended May 31, 2024 (Q1 FY25) came in within RHB Research and consensus' expectations following their strong growth momentum. 

RHB Research noted the company's financing receivables maintained its growth momentum, and asset quality indicators showed year-on-year (YoY) improvements. 

Non-interest income grew 16 per cent YoY, largely due to the strong 13 per cent YoY growth in financing receivables, though the cost-income ratio creeped

title: Reits in Malaysia still a solid defensive yield play: RHB Research
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Real estate investment trusts (REITs) will remain a strong defensive yield play in 2025, given the stable economic and rental growth outlook. RHB Investment Bank Bhd (RHB Research) said the market is still waiting for interest rate cuts to ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Real estate investment trusts (REITs) will remain a strong defensive yield play in 2025, given the stable economic and rental growth outlook. 

RHB Investment Bank Bhd (RHB Research) said the market is still waiting for interest rate cuts to begin in the region. 

The firm has maintained a "neutral" stance on the sector and selected Axis REIT and Sunway REIT as its top picks. 

"With high occupancy rates and normalised rental reversions moving forward, we prefer REITs with more inorganic growth prospects,

title: Sabah Development Bank gets backing from state govt over RM5bil NPLs
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The state government maintains strong support for Sabah Development Bank (SDB) and assures the security and recoverability of the latter's RM5 billion in non-performing loans (NPLs).According to Sabah finance minister Datuk Seri Masidi Manjun, the RM5 ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The state government maintains strong support for Sabah Development Bank (SDB) and assures the security and recoverability of the latter's RM5 billion in non-performing loans (NPLs).

According to Sabah finance minister Datuk Seri Masidi Manjun, the RM5 billion in NPLs are recoverable because they are mainly secured against land-based assets that are the subject of ongoing recovery efforts.

"I wish to reaffirm the state's support to the bank in times of need, particularly our commitment to ensure th

title: Oil settles down on weaker US consumer sentiment
summary: Oil futures prices settled slightly lower on Friday as investors weighed weaker US consumer sentiment against mounting hopes for a Federal Reserve rate cut in September.
content:
Brent crude futures settled 37 cents lower to US$85.03 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude futures fell 41 cents, or 0.5%, to close at US$82.21 a barrel.

NEW YORK: Oil futures prices settled slightly lower on Friday as investors weighed weaker US consumer sentiment against mounting hopes for a Federal Reserve rate cut in September.

title: Wall St closes higher on bets for Fed rate cut
summary: Wall Street closed higher on Friday, with the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average hitting intraday record highs, on bets that the US Federal Reserve will cut interest rates in September, while big banks fell after reporting mixed results.
content:
The S&P 500 climbed 0.55% to end the session at 5,615.35 points. The Nasdaq gained 0.63% at 18,398.45 points, while the Dow rose 0.62% to 40,000.90 points.

OAKLAND, California: Wall Street closed higher on Friday, with the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average hitting intraday record highs, on bets that the US Federal Reserve will cut interest rates in September, while big banks fell after reporting

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Investors looking beyond Big Tech
summary: Looming US interest rate cuts are presenting investors with a tough choice: stick with the Big Tech stocks that have driven returns for more than a year or turn to less-loved areas of the market that could benefit from easing monetary policy.
content:
Lower rates are seen as beneficial to many corners of the market whose performance has lagged this year, including small-caps, real estate and economically sensitive areas such as industrials. — Reuters

title: Carbon tax conundrum
summary: Once again, Malaysia is at the crossroads of an unpopular tax decision, this time it is on the rollout of a carbon tax.
content:
ONCE again, Malaysia is at the crossroads of an unpopular tax decision, this time it is on the rollout of a carbon tax.

This matter was brought to the fore when a carbon tax was mentioned by the Deputy Minister of International Trade and Industry Liew Chin Tong last week as a counter-measure against the European Union’s (EU) Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) that is scheduled to commence on Jan 1, 2026.

title: Synergy House brings innovation to the table
summary: The furniture business can be a tricky one. Putting aside the challenge of having to compete against low-cost producers like China and Vietnam, players also need to be agile to adapt to eCommerce trends.
content:
Synergy House executive director Elon Teh.

THE furniture business can be a tricky one. Putting aside the challenge of having to compete against low-cost producers like China and Vietnam, players also need to be agile to adapt to eCommerce trends.

One company that seems to have understood this well is Synergy House Bhd

title: UK emerges as haven from global storms
summary: Investors are looking at UK markets as a potential haven as political uncertainty rises in the United States and elsewhere in Europe, in what could mark a stunning turnaround for a country that appeared to have lost its traditional appeal to global capital.
content:
Some bankers expect a revival for UK stock markets shrivelled by relentless selling during years of turbulence under successive Conservative governments. — Reuters

INVESTORS are looking at UK markets as a potential haven as political uncertainty rises in the United States and elsewhere in Europe, in what could mark a stunning turnaround for a country that appeared to have lost its traditional appeal to global c

title: Bracing for the CBAM impact
summary: In Europe, going green is increasingly a compulsion. Besides intense, and sometimes radical, efforts to promote public awareness of environmental issues, new regulations are continuously introduced to enforce sustainability standards across industries and incentivise the adoption of eco-friendly practices.
content:
IN Europe, going green is increasingly a compulsion. Besides intense, and sometimes radical, efforts to promote public awareness of environmental issues, new regulations are continuously introduced to enforce sustainability standards across industries and incentivise the adoption of eco-friendly practices.

Take the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM).

title: Empowering SMEs in their digital transformation
summary: With technology rapidly revolving at a breakneck pace, small and medium enterprises (SMEs) are finding it difficult to match this pace and meet their technological needs.
content:
SRKK Consulting Sdn Bhd CEO Yew Lip Sin.

With technology rapidly revolving at a breakneck pace, small and medium enterprises (SMEs) are finding it difficult to match this pace and meet their technological needs.

This situation is further exacerbated by the rising costs for the adoption of advanced technology amid inflationary pressures.

title: Competition for medical tourists heats up among Asean countries
summary: The thriving medical tourism scene in Malaysia appears to have gotten several countries in the region sitting up and taking notice.
content:
BMI said partnerships will continue to be a feature in Malaysia’s efforts to bolster its medical tourism industry, as it seeks to maintain competitiveness.

THE thriving medical tourism scene in Malaysia appears to have gotten several countries in the region sitting up and taking notice.

Vietnam, Thailand and Indonesia are taking steps to up their game to get a bigger share of the lucrative medical tourism

title: Surviving the hottest summers on record
summary: Last year was certainly the hottest summer ever, according to the magazine Scientific American.
content:
Mongolia needs external aid to deal with climate change beyond its own control. — Reuters

LAST year was certainly the hottest summer ever, according to the magazine Scientific American.

This summer is not yet over, but it certainly feels like it will break last year’s record. My air conditioning bill has gone up because the nights are hotter.

title: A good half-year mark for Bursa Malaysia
summary: There is an inside joke among my team of fund managers: whenever I comment that the stock market is performing well, the following days often see a pullback.
content:
There were many opportunities for investors to profit from this stock market rally.

THERE is an inside joke among my team of fund managers: whenever I comment that the stock market is performing well, the following days often see a pullback.

It has happened on many occasions, so much so that the boys would always cringe when I praise their performance or the market, fearing I would jinx things. Let’s hope

title: Fed pivot on the horizon
summary: Since the start of the year, the US Federal Reserve’s (Fed) rate cut expectations have been a guessing game for the longest time as the Fed has maintained the current rate of between 5.25% and 5.50% for the past 12 months and counting.
content:
Given the signals and tone of the Fed, it is likely that the FFR will be cut by 50 bps this year. — Reuters

SINCE the start of the year, the US Federal Reserve’s (Fed) rate cut expectations have been a guessing game for the longest time as the Fed has maintained the current rate of between 5.25% and 5.50% for the past 12 months and counting.

summary: ONG Hang Ping and his business partner, Chow Kian Hung, were just 29 years old when they bought into a solar power system contractor business almost a decade ago.
content:
Ong says Sunview is currently talking to several data centre developers to supply power via TPA.

title: Holistic approach to developing data centres
summary: As of late, several developers have been announcing their entry or continuing expansion into the data centre space.
content:
KGV International Property Consultants executive director Samuel Tan.

AS of late, several developers have been announcing their entry or continuing expansion into the data centre space.

However, as appealing as the segment might seem, experts point out that much work needs to be done first before the rewards can be reaped.

title: Robust plans needed to spur high-skilled jobs
summary: Malaysia needs robust strategies to boost high-skilled job growth, as part of the country’s move up the value chain and complement the Progressive Wage Policy (PWP), says Malaysian Chinese Association (MCA) president Datuk Seri Dr Wee Ka Siong.
content:
SUNGAI LONG: Malaysia needs robust strategies to boost high-skilled job growth, as part of the country’s move up the value chain and complement the Progressive Wage Policy (PWP), says Malaysian Chinese Association (MCA) president Datuk Seri Dr Wee Ka Siong.

title: Lessons from Malaysia’s Silver State
summary: It's an honest book. Not many people, especially if they come from Perak, wish to talk so openly and frankly about the decline of the state after the collapse of the tin mining industry.
content:
Deep insight: Globalization: Perak’s Rise, Relative Decline, and Regeneration.

IT’S an honest book. Not many people, especially if they come from Perak, wish to talk so openly and frankly about the decline of the state after the collapse of the tin mining industry.

His Royal Highness Sultan Nazrin Shah, preferred to use the word “relative decline’’ in his recently released book.

StanChart maintains its relative outperformance view of the ringgit within the regional forex complex.
